 [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָבַע‎</span>] **verb** ==flow, spring, bubble up==, in poetry and late (Late Hebrew ***id.*** (rare); Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***nabû***</u></abbr>, ***id.***, [[BDB#Dl|Dl]]<sup>HWB 442</sup>; Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***well*** or ***issue forth*** (of water); Aramaic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נְבַע‎</span>; Ethiopic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> II. ***weep***, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***tear(s)***); — 

**Qal** ***Participle*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נַ֫חַל נֹבֵעַ‎</span> [[Prov.18.4|Prov 18:4]] ***a flowing wady***, metaphor of <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מְקוֺר חָכְמָה‎</span>. **Hiph\`il** ***Imperfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יַבִּיעַ‎</span> [[Ps.19.3|Ps 19:3]] + 3 t.; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אַבְּ֫יעָה‎</span> [[Ps.78.2|Ps 78:2]]; [[Prov.1.23|Prov 1:23]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יַבִּ֫יעוּ‎</span> [[Ps.94.4|Ps 94:4]]; [[Ps.145.7|Ps 145:7]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יַבִּיעוּן‎</span> [[Ps.59.8|Ps 59:8]] 3 feminine plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תַּבַּ֫עְנָה‎</span> [[Ps.119.171|Ps 119:171]] — ***pour out, emit, cause to bubble, belch forth:*** 

**1.** ***pour out***, figurative <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אַבִּיעָה לָכֶם רוּחִי‎</span> [[Prov.1.23|Prov 1:23]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אוֺדִ֫יעָה‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דְבָרַי אֶתְכֶם‎</span>). 

**2.** ***cause to bubble, ferment*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זְבוּבֵי מָ֫וֶת יַבְאִישׁ יַכִּיעַ שֶׁמֶן רוֺקֵ֑חַ‎</span> [[Eccl.10.1|Eccl 10:1]]. 

**3.** figurative, usually of speech, ***pour forth, emit, belch forth***, emphatic expression: <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎פִּי רְשָׁעִים יַבִּיעַ רָעוֺת‎</span> [[Prov.15.28|Prov 15:28]] (opposed to <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לֵב צַדִּיק יֶהְגֶּה לַעֲנוֺת‎</span>) i.e. the righteous considers before he speaks, the wicked bursts out with reckless utterance; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎פִּי כְסִילִים יַבִּיעַ אִוֶּלֶת‎</span> [[Prov.15.2|Prov 15:2]] (opposed to <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְשׁוֺן חֲכָמִים תֵּיטִיב דָּ֑עַת‎</span>); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יַבִּ֫יעוּ יְדַבְּרוּ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עָתָק‎</span> [[Ps.94.4|Ps 94:4]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִתְאַמְּרוּ כָּלפֹּֿעֲלֵי אָ֑וֶן‎</span>); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּפִיהֶם‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יַבּ‎</span> [[Ps.59.8|Ps 59:8]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חֲרָבוֺת בְּשִׂפְתוֺתֵיהֶם‎</span>); in good sense, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אַבִּ֫יעָה חִידוֺת‎</span> [[Ps.78.2|Ps 78:2]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶפְתֳּחה בְּמָשָׁל פִּי‎</span>); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תַּבַּעְנָה שְׂפָתַי תְּהִלָּה‎</span> [[Ps.119.171|Ps 119:171]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זֵכֶר רַבטֿוּבְךָ יִבִּ֑יעוּ‎</span> [[Ps.145.7|Ps 145:7]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְצִדְקָֽתְךָ יְרַנֵּ֑נוּ‎</span>, compare also v[[Ps.145.6|Ps 145:6]]); metaphor <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֹמֶר‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יוֺם לְיוֺם יַבּ‎</span> [[Ps.19.3|Ps 19:3]], i. e. though silent, it really ***pours forth*** speech.
